thread.title: Mules rally past Champion, to District 27-5A title
thread.title_full: Mules rally past Champion, to District 27-5A title

author: Terrence Thomas, Staff writer
title: Mules rally past Champion, to District 27-5A title
text:
Mules rally past Champion, to District 27-5A title By Terrence Thomas Published 10:50 pm, Tuesday, October 20, 2015 
BOERNE — As Alamo Heights junior Callie Cook thought back, she recalled the uncertainty back in August. 
How would the Mules replace the big-time players who graduated off last year’s squad that fell one win shy of advancing to the UIL Class 5A state tournament? Would the newcomers be able to overcome their inexperience to help make a contribution? 
As Alamo Heights’ players celebrated at midcourt — hugging one moment, taking pictures the next — the answers to the inquiries were clear. 
The No. 9 Mules outlasted Boerne Champion 19-25, 22-25, 25-19, 25-20, 19-17 on Tuesday to capture the District 27-5A title, fending off two match points and rallying from a five-point deficit in the decisive frame to prevail. 
It was the Mules’ 45th straight district win, the area’s longest active district streak and tied with Reagan (2008-11) for the ninth-longest in area history. 
For more, visit ExpressNews.com.
